name: InternationalPatientAccessAPI
title: CapabilityStatement - International Patient Access
description: Basic rules for International Patient Access
copyright: Used by permission of HL7 International, all rights reserved Creative Commons License

rest.documentation:
The IPA Server **SHALL**:

1. Support the IPA Patient resource profile.
1. Support at least one additional resource profile from the list of IPA Profiles.
1. Implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification.
1. Return the following response classes:
   - (Status 400): invalid parameter
   - (Status 401/4xx): unauthorized request
   - (Status 403): insufficient scope
   - (Status 404): unknown resource
   - (Status 410): deleted resource.
1. Support json source formats for all IPA interactions.
1. Declare a CapabilityStatement identifying the list of profiles, operations, search parameter supported.

The IPA Server **SHOULD**:

1. Support xml source formats for all IPA interactions.
1. Identify the IPA profiles supported as part of the FHIR `meta.profile` attribute for each instance.
1. Support xml resource formats for all IPA questionnaire interactions.

security.description:
1. See the [General Security Considerations](security.html) section for requirements and recommendations.
1. A server **SHALL** reject any unauthorized requests by returning an `HTTP 401` unauthorized response code.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Code that identifies the allergy or intolerance

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Date first version of the resource instance was recorded

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Time when the event was recorded

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: draft | active | suspended | completed | entered-in-error | cancelled | unknown

searchParam.name: clinical-status
searchParam.documentation: The clinical status of the condition

searchParam.name: verification-status
searchParam.documentation: unconfirmed | provisional | differential | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Which diagnostic discipline/department created the report

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: The code for the report, as opposed to codes for the atomic results, which are the names on the observation resource referred to from the result

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: The clinically relevant time of the report

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: The Encounter when the order was made

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: When this document reference was created

searchParam.name: period
searchParam.documentation: Time of service that is being documented

operation.name: docref
operation.documentation:
A server **SHALL** be capable of responding to a $docref operation and  capable of returning at least a reference to a generated CCD document, if available. **MAY** provide references to other 'on-demand' and 'stable' documents (or 'delayed/deferred assembly') that meet the query parameters as well. If a context date range is supplied the server ** SHOULD**  provide references to any document that falls within the date range If no date range is supplied, then the server **SHALL** provide references to last or current encounter.  **SHOULD** document what resources, if any, are returned as included resources

`GET [base]/DocumentReference/$docref?patient=[id]`

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: A date within the period the Encounter lasted

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +

resource.documentation: The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using an external reference to a Medication resource. If an external Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria  **SHALL**  be supported.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Return prescriptions of this medication code

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Returns medication request to be administered on a specific date

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Return prescriptions with this encounter identifier

resource.documentation:
The MedicationStatement resources can represent a medication using either a code or refer to the Medication resource. When referencing Medication, the resource may be [contained](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#contained) or an external resource. The server application **MAY** choose any one way or more than one method, but if an external reference to Medication is used, the server **SHALL** support the _include` parameter for searching this element. The client application must support all methods.

 For example, A server **SHALL** be capable of returning all medications for a patient using one of or both:

 `GET /MedicationRequest?patient=[id]`

 `GET /MedicationRequest?patient=[id]&_include=MedicationRequest:medication`

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Returns statements of this category of medicationstatement

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Return statements of this medication code

searchParam.name: effective
searchParam.documentation: Date when patient was taking (or not taking) the medication

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Return statements that match the given status

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: The classification of the type of observation

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: The code of the observation type

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: A code to identify a  procedure

resource.documentation: If a system receives a provider in `Provenance.agent.who` as free text they must capture who sent them the information as the organization. On request they **SHALL** provide this organization as the source and **MAY** include the free text provider.

searchParam.name: recorded
searchParam.documentation: When the activity was recorded / updated

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: A code that corresponds to one of its items in the questionnaire

searchParam.name: effective
searchParam.documentation: The time during which the questionnaire is intended to be in use

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: Computationally friendly name of the questionnaire

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The current status of the questionnaire

searchParam.name: authored
searchParam.documentation: When the questionnaire response was last changed

searchParam.name: questionnaire
searchParam.documentation: The questionnaire the answers are provided for

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status of the questionnaire response
